messages.content: You are tasked with creating a structured output from the provided user message.

Full HTTP request path:
/v1/book

All methods acceptable: False

HEAD: False
POST: True
OPTIONS: False
TRACE: False
GET: True
PUT: False
DELETE: False
PATCH: False

Explanation:
- The application registers the v1 blueprint at url_prefix "/v1" in app/__init__.py: app.register_blueprint(create_v1(), url_prefix="/v1").
- create_v1() (app/api/v1/__init__.py) registers the book blueprint under url_prefix "/book": bp_v1.register_blueprint(book_api, url_prefix="/book").
- Combining those prefixes yields the base path "/v1/book".
- In app/api/v1/book.py there are two route decorators that target the empty subpath ("") on that blueprint:
  - @book_api.route("") with no methods specified binds get_books — this corresponds to an explicit GET handler in the code.
  - @book_api.route("", methods=["POST"]) binds create_book — this explicitly accepts POST.
- The other methods (PUT, DELETE, PATCH) are implemented on the path with an id parameter ("/<int:id>"), not on the base "/v1/book", so they are not acceptable for this specific path.
- Methods not explicitly declared in the decorators (HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE) are marked False because the determination is based on the source code decorators only.
